column2: DELAWARE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column4: place their foot on the accelerator.
column6: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.

column2: 2. These are:
3. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column6: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 4. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
5. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: if you have the green light.
column6: on the opposite side of the street.

column2: 6. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 7. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 8. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
9. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column8: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 10. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 11. This sign means:
12. This road sign means:
13. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column8: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 14. If you have to wait for a space to enter a freeway, you should:
column4: slow down on the ramp and search ahead for a gap in traffic on the freeway.
column6: stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap in traffic.
column8: maintain speed and signal other drivers to make a gap.

column2: 15. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column4: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 16. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in residential areas is:
17. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 18. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: drive fast to let off steam.
column6: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.
column8: listen to loud music while driving.

column2: 19. When driving in work zones you should:
column6: gradually come to a complete stop and wait for a flagger to guide traffic safely through the work zone.
column8: carefully watch for workers and moving equipment.

column2: 20. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column6: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.

column2: 21. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
22. You should use your low beams any time you are driving:
23. This road sign means:
column8: You have the right of way

column2: 24. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column6: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column8: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 25. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 26. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 27. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 28. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
column6: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.

column2: 29. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
